how would you describe your main use cas: Journalling;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: Yes, and I am the only editor/administrator of my wiki(s)
putting it all together, what value does: I use it a lot as a personal notebook : journal, task magmt, aide-memoire, project logging ... And occasionally as a convenient way to publish some content, for example my personal webpage or some project documentation. Overall, TW has a huge value for organizing my content.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki with custom saver (e.g. TiddlyPWA, Timimi, tw5-browser-nativesaver)
how do you back up/sync changes between: Consumer online storage (e.g. Google Drive, Dropbox);Web or cloud hosting (other than TiddlyHost/TiddlySpot e.g. Netlify, AWS, OVH, Google Cloud...)

what are we doing well? prompts for thin: I don't have time to read all the messages but I try to read important announcements, and as far as I can tell there has always been a friendly and cooperating tone to the discussions, and I assume the decisions made for TW. I think this is essential to both a good direction for TW and a reliable community of users.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
I'm a bit lost in all the channels, and I feel that I don't really follow TW news as much as I would like (but honestly this is mostly on me!).

I often feel a bit shy when I ask a question on TW Talk, because I don't know if it's the right place to ask, I don't always know how to search, etc. Again, probably just me ;)
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
